title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Chinese authorities are using a new tool to hack seized phones and extract data
items.description: Researchers warned that Chinese residents, and visitors to China, should be aware of the tool's existence and the risks it poses.

items.title: Join Our Livestream: Inside the AI Copyright Battles
items.description: Curious about generative AI and copyright? Subscribers can join WIRED live on July 16 as we answer your questions about this critical topic.

items.title: Another High-Profile OpenAI Researcher Departs for Meta
items.description: Jason Wei, who worked on OpenAI’s o3 and deep research models, will be joining Meta’s superintelligence lab. His colleague Hyung Won Chung is also joi...

items.title: Chewy Promo Codes: $20 Off | July 2025
items.description: Explore Chewy coupon codes like $20 off your first order, free shipping, and more deals you won’t want to miss.

items.title: Of course, Grok’s AI companions want to have sex and burn down schools
items.description: xAI's first AI companions on the Grok app are a lustful anime girl and a homicidal panda.

items.title: I Tried Grok’s Built-In Anime Companion and It Called Me a Twat
items.description: xAI’s new $300 monthly subscription comes with two AI companions powered by its most capable model to date. I tried them. It got weird.

items.title: Thinking Machines Lab Raises a Record $2 Billion, Announces Cofounders
items.description: Mira Murati and several other former OpenAI researchers are behind the buzzy AI startup, now valued at $12 billion and officially out of stealth.

items.title: Amazon’s Kuiper satellites to get boost from rival SpaceX
items.description: Amazon is looking to its main competitor to get its next batch of Kuiper satellites to orbit.

items.title: The Chainsmokers’ Mantis Ventures closes $100M third fund
items.description: The fund brings Mantis' assets under management to $225 million.

items.title: US Army soldier pleads guilty to hacking telcos and extortion
items.description: Cameron Wagenius had already pleaded guilty to other charges earlier this year.
